article.title: Thompson Sampling for Linear-Quadratic Control Problems

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the condition `det(Vt) > 2 det(Vo)` in the Thompson sampling algorithm?
choices: To ensure the algorithm explores sufficiently.
To limit the number of policy updates.
To guarantee the stability of the system.
To update the sampling distribution.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the role of the rejection sampling operator `Rs` in the algorithm?
choices: To enforce exploration by sampling parameters outside of the confidence ellipsoid.
To project the sampled parameters onto the set of admissible parameters.
To ensure the sampled parameters follow a Gaussian distribution.
To update the design matrix Vt based on the sampled parameter.

multiple_choice_question.text: What happens when the condition in line 3 of the algorithm is met?
choices: The algorithm terminates.
A new parameter is sampled until it belongs to the admissible set S.
The current parameter is kept, and the control is applied.
The design matrix Vt is reset to its initial value.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the parameter `τ` in the algorithm?
choices: It determines the frequency of updating the design matrix Vt.
It controls the exploration-exploitation trade-off.
It defines the maximum length of an episode.
It sets the radius of the confidence ellipsoid.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the term β<sub>t</sub>(δ) represent in the context of the article?
choices: The regret incurred by the Thompson Sampling algorithm at time t.
The probability of sampling an optimistic parameter at time t.
The radius of the confidence ellipsoid used for the RLS estimate at time t.
The upper bound on the difference between the true and estimated parameter at time t.

multiple_choice_question.text: How does the value of β<sub>t</sub>(δ) change as the time step t increases?
choices: It always increases.
It always decreases.
It generally decreases but may fluctuate depending on the observed data.
It depends on the chosen value of the regularization parameter λ.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the impact of the parameter δ on the value of β<sub>t</sub>(δ)?
choices: A larger δ leads to a larger β<sub>t</sub>(δ).
A larger δ leads to a smaller β<sub>t</sub>(δ).
The value of δ does not impact β<sub>t</sub>(δ).
The relationship between δ and β<sub>t</sub>(δ) is complex and depends on other parameters.
